title: 110_s3097
content: The "Vietnam Education Foundation Amendments Act of 2008" establishes the Vietnam Education Foundation within the Department of State, replacing the Board of Directors with an Advisory Committee. The Vietnam Education Foundation Advisory Committee is established with 7 members appointed by various government officials to provide advice on the Foundation's activities. The Advisory Committee of the Vietnam Education Foundation may include former members of the Foundation's Board of Directors. The Foundation is supervised by the Secretary and the Assistant Secretary for Educational and Cultural Affairs, in consultation with the Advisory Committee. Amendments are made to the Fellowship Program under Section 206(a) of the Act. Amendments are made to the Fellowship Program under Section 206(a) of the Act to prioritize individuals studying basic sciences for post-secondary education in the United States. Amendments to the Act include redefining the term "Secretary" and making changes to various sections such as 203 and 208 to align with the new definitions. Amendments to the Mutual Educational and Cultural Exchange Act of 1961 involve changing references from "Board" to "Secretary" in various sections and adding programs administered by the Vietnam Education Foundation. All functions and assets of the Foundation are transferred to the Bureau of Educational. The functions and assets of the Vietnam Education Foundation are transferred to the Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs of the Department of State. The Assistant Secretary for Educational and Cultural Affairs can hire personnel from the Foundation and others as needed to support it. SEC. 3. AMERICAN RESEARCH COLLEGE IN VIETNAM. The Secretary of State can award grants to institutions of higher education to establish an American Research College in Vietnam for Vietnamese undergraduate students. Institutions must submit applications for the grants on a competitive basis. The Secretary of State can award grants on a competitive basis for the establishment of an American Research College in Vietnam. Funds may be sourced from the Vietnam Education Foundation, and the Government of Vietnam is encouraged to contribute financially or in-kind. SEC. 4. EFFECTIVE DATE: This Act and its amendments will take effect 90 days after enactment.
